author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Hello, I am an automated registration bot. I help manage the registration process by checking your registration against a set of [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). If all these guidelines are met, this pull request will be merged automatically, completing your registration. It is **strongly recommended** to follow the guidelines, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

## 1. New package registration

Please make sure that you have read the [package naming guidelines](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1).

## 2. [AutoMerge Guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/) are all met! ✅

Your new package registration met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

## 3. To pause or stop registration

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.

_Tip: You can edit blocking comments to add `[noblock]` in order to unblock auto-merging._

<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Is there a typo in the package name? Shouldn’t it be `SimplexTableau`?

[noblock]

> Is there a typo in the package name? Shouldn’t it be `SimplexTableau`?

Great question! No, it's not a typo. Julia packages are often named by pluralizing their main objects. So the `Graphs` package defines `Graph` as the main data type. For this one, the main data type is `Tableau` and the proper plural is `Tableaux`. I added `Simple` because it's really a demonstration project for understanding how linear programs can be solved. It is not at all competitive with `HiGHS` or other optimization packages.

Sorry, I had a typo in my question… LOL. What I meant to ask is about `Simplex` vs `Simple`, not `Tableau` vs `Tablaux`. It's up to you, in principle, but people might get confused, since the description says "using the simplex method by pivoting tableaux".

Personally, I also have a bit of a dislike for "Simple" in package names. It's one of those meaningless words. What if someone makes a `Tableaux`-related package that's even "simpler"? But it's not enough of an objection to go up in arms about it. I just want to make sure you're choosing the name deliberately.

If you want to keep the name as-is, you can just edit your comment to contain [noblock]

> Sorry, I had a typo in my question… LOL. What I meant to ask is about `Simplex` vs `Simple`, not `Tableau` vs `Tablaux`. It's up to you, in principle, but people might get confused, since the description says "using the simplex method by pivoting tableaux".
> 
> Personally, I also have a bit of a dislike for "Simple" in package names. It's one of those meaningless words. What if someone makes a `Tableaux`-related package that's even "simpler"? But it's not enough of an objection to go up in arms about it. I just want to make sure you're choosing the name deliberately.
> 
> If you want to keep the name as-is, you can just edit your comment to contain [noblock]

@goerz : I have thought some more about your suggestion and I rather like `SimplexTableaux` as a name for this module. Is there a way I can cancel this attempted registration (or can you do it for me) and I'll resubmit under the new name?

Yes, you just rename the package and re-register it, see the [instructions in the FAQ](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General?tab=readme-ov-file#what-to-do-when-asked-to-reconsiderupdate-the-package-name). Then, I can close this PR in favor of the new one.

> Yes, you just rename the package and re-register it, see the [instructions in the FAQ](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General?tab=readme-ov-file#what-to-do-when-asked-to-reconsiderupdate-the-package-name). Then, I can close this PR in favor of the new one.

Great! Please "kill" this version and I'll re-register under the new name later today. Thanks the suggestion and your help.

body:
